etymologies: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French, from the Old French verb mesnommer, from mes- ‘wrongly’ + nommer ‘to name’ (based on Latin nomen ‘name’)

definitions: a wrong or inaccurate name or designation

examples.text: morning sickness is a misnomer for many women, since the nausea can occur any time during the day

shortDefinitions: wrong or inaccurate name or designation

definitions: a wrong or inaccurate use of a name or term

examples.text: to call this ‘neighbourhood policing’ would be a misnomer

shortDefinitions: wrong or inaccurate use of name or term
